emailResetPasswordTextBottom: In case you did not initiate this request yourself, you can safely ignore this message.
emailResetPasswordTextTop: the requested authentication token for your account on {} can be found below. You can use that token in order to create a new password for you now.
heading: Heading
imageSlideshowBlockBreakpoints: Number of images based on block size
imageSlideshowBlockBreakpointsError: Please enter valid breakpoints that include block width and image width separate by a colon.
imageSlideshowBlockBreakpointsHelp: Add breakpoints as pairs of a minimum block size and a number of images per view, separated by a colon. Multiple breakpoints can be separated by whitespace.

passwordRepeatError: Please enter twice the same new password!
passwordRequirementsError: A password must at least contain one character of {1} and has a minimum length of {2} characters.
passwordResetEnterNameOrEmail: Please enter your username or email address in order to request an authentication token to create a new password for your account.
passwordResetEnterNewPassword: An email including an authentication token has been sent to you. Please enter that token below along with a new password.
passwordResetVerificationError: The authentication token is invalid or has expired already!
preventDataOverwritingError: A newer version has been edited in another browser tab. Please reload this page in order to continue.
searchNoResults: Your search did not return any results.
sectionHasNoFields: There are no fields defined in this section.
selectTargetNewPage: Select a location for the new page
signedOutSuccess: You have been successfully signed out.
systemCacheCardInfo: Clear the cache, purge cached items or change caching settings
systemCacheClearInfo: Clearing the site cache forces a rescan for updated pages and files. This action will not remove any page files or images from the cache directory.
systemCacheInfo: Caching is essential to speed up your site and should generally be enabled. However under some circumstances you might want to disable or clear your cache.
systemCacheLifetimeInfo: All cached Automad data and pages have a maximum lifetime. After the lifetime of an object exceeds, its cache will be rebuilt when requested.
systemCacheMonitorInfo: When caching is enabled, Automad will check regularly for changes in the file system. The frequency of those checks can be defined here.
systemCachePurgeInfo: In contrast to simply clearing the cache, purging the cache directory will also move all temporary files, deleted pages, update-backups and cached images to the temporary directory of the system. This will force a full rebuild of the image and page cache as well as a cleanup of all deleted pages. On most systems the temporary directory will be cleaned up automatically from time to time or on reboot. However, on some systems temporary directories has to be purged manually.
systemDebugCardInfo: Enable debugging in order to identify issues with your installation
systemDebugInfo: When debugging is enabled, all of Automad's processes will be logged to your browser's console as well as to .json files inside the temporary directory. Debugging is only needed for development or troubleshooting and should be disabled in all other cases.
systemI18nInfo: Internationalization can be enabled in order to route visitors to pages that are served in the language that matches their locale. Adding languages can be achieved by grouping pages of a particular language under a top-level page that has a two letter language code as slug such as /en or /de. The first top-level page serves as fallback for all languages that are not available on a site.
systemLanguageCardInfo: Change the language for the Automad user interface
systemLanguageInfo: There are several languages available for the Automad user interface. The translations are created automatically. This feature is still in an experimental phase and therefore some translations might not be accurate.
systemMailCardInfo: Configure how emails are sent by your server
systemMailInfo: You can configure how emails are sent for registration, account recovery or from contact forms on the website. By default, Automad uses PHP's sendmail function for this. However, it is recommended to send emails via an SMTP server, whose access data can be entered below.
systemMailReset: Do you want to reset the current email configuration?
systemMailSendTestSuccess: A test email was successfully sent to
systemMailSmtpPasswordPlaceholder: Leave this field empty in order to keep the existing password
systemRssFeedCardInfo: Enable and configure the RSS feed for your site
systemRssFeedFields: You can sort, add or remove the fields that should be included in the RSS feed by dragging them onto one of the two areas below.
systemRssFeedFieldsInfoUnused: Move elements into this area in order to remove them from the RSS feed
systemRssFeedFieldsInfoUsed: Move elements into this area in order to add them to the RSS feed
systemRssFeedInfo: When the RSS feed option is enabled, Automad will automatically generate an RSS feed document and publish it under the URL that is displayed below in order to allow users to follow your newest posts.
systemRssFeedUrl: The RSS feed will be available under the following link. You can add it to your navigation by adding a new page and using the URL below as value for the redirect field.
systemUpdateAvailable:
A newer version of Automad is available and ready to be installed.
Please carefully read the release notes before upgrading and backup your current installation!
systemUpdateCardInfo: Update Automad to the latest available version
systemUpdateConnectionError: Can't connect to the update server! This could typically be caused by a wrong update configuration (config/config.php), a SSL certificate error or a missing cURL library.
systemUpdateDisabled: Can't run updates within the development repository!
systemUpdateFailedError: Update failed! Please restore your installation from a backup.
systemUpdateItems: Note that the following files and directories are affected by the update:
systemUpdateItemsError: Invalid list of items to be updated!
systemUpdateNotSupportedError: Updates are not supported by your server! The updater requires cURL and ZIP libraries to be installed.
systemUpdatePhpVersionError: Your PHP version doesn't support the latest Automad version. Please upgrade PHP to version
systemUpdateProgress: Please wait and don't close the window while updating ...
systemUsersCardInfo: Edit your profile information, change your password or invite other users
systemUsersInfo: Here you can find all information related to your account and change your username, password or email. In order to be able to reset your password by email, please make sure that you have entered a vaild and active email address below.
systemUsersRegisteredInfo: It is also possible to register other users in order to allow them to edit content.
systemUsersSendInvitationSuccess: The invitation has been sent successfully.
themeReadme: Open readme file of current theme
trashClearConfirm: Do you really want to clear the trash directory?
trashPermanentlyDeleteConfirm: Do you want to permanently delete this page?
tuneOrMove: Click to tune or drag to move
